programme.title: The Thorn of the Rose
programme.desc: Prosecuting Attorney David Lunga's success is overshadowed by the terrifying secrets of Rosa, a beautiful but mysterious woman with whom he falls in love. What mysteries does she hide? As the macabre facts unravel, David comes face to face with his own demons and is driven to prove his innocence, recover his reputation and, above all, clear his own conscience.

programme.title: AFROPOLITAINE EP 1
programme.desc: Afropolitaine is a web-series focused on the Afro-French culture. Afropolitaine tells the story of two Paris-based millennials sisters and their family dynamics.

programme.title: DAVID'S REVEIRE
programme.desc: David is living his lifelong dream of becoming a star trumpet player when he is struck by epilepsy and the unpredictable seizures.

programme.title: The Runaways
programme.desc: Abused and neglected, Kellee attempts to run away with her boyfriend James, only to be chased and cornered by her abusive stepfather. What follows is a series of events that leads to a violent confrontation with the abusive man who terrorizes her life.

programme.title: THE LONG ROAD TO HALL OF FAME
programme.desc: The Long Road To The Hall Of Fame is a feature length documentary about Malik Farrakhan, his life is a parable spanning the last 40 years of African-American history.

programme.title: JERMAINE
programme.desc: Jermaine Johnson is a 36-year old father of three and husband to his high-school sweetheart, Lawanna.

programme.title: BURKINABE RISING
programme.desc: BurkinabĂ¨ Rising showcases creative nonviolent resistance in Burkina Faso. A small, landlocked country in West Africa, Burkina Faso is home to a vibrant community of artists and engaged citizens, who provide an example of the type of political change that can be achieved when people come together.

programme.title: KEEPING OUR LOVED ONES ALIVE
programme.desc: Based on testimonies of the mothers and family victims of state violence in the Baixada Fluminense, this documentary addresses police violence in the lowland of Rio de Janeiro and brings a critical view of the State’s brutality, especially against black youth

programme.title: WAVES S1 EP1
programme.desc: Nia and her sister Jean have an estranged relationship after Jean becomes close with alcohol and partying, around the same time Nia was going through a break up with her fiancĂ©. Jean now returns a year later hoping to mend the relationship with her sister. However, she has a secret that will rip their relationship apart for good.

programme.desc: Nia and her sister Jean have an estranged relationship after Jean becomes close with alcohol and partying, around the same time Nia was going through a break up with her fiancĂ©. programme.title: Something Necessary
programme.desc: Joseph, a troubled young gang member who participated in the countrywide violence is drawn to Anne and her farm seemingly in search of redemption. Both he and Anne need something that only the other can give to allow them to shed the painful memories of their past and move on â€“ but will either of them find it?

programme.title: BLACK MUSEUM
programme.desc: Through interviews and observation, Director Oliver Hardt, who frequently addresses black history and culture with a strong emphasis on architecture, takes us through the remarkable physical spaces, the palpable engagement of museum visitors, and gives us insight into the challenges faced during the design process. The success of the project serves as a reminder that design and advanced storytelling can challenge the dominant political discourse and enable a diverse conversation.

programme.title: What's More Important Episode 1
programme.desc: R.C. struggles in his job hunting due to the lack of one crucial skill while desperately attempting to pay off his debts.'

programme.title: Wingmen Episode 1
programme.desc: Three's Company': Theo arrives at the bar to help friends and married couple Jason and Lauren score a threesome in order to 'help' their rocky relationship. Here we are introduced to the series regulars and supporting cast in the form of Fatima, Byron, Jason, Lauren and Trina.

programme.title: LadyLike
programme.desc: Ladylike is a short film collaboration between Tiffany Johnson and Nicholas Williams, two best friends who met a decade ago in film school. Directed by Tiffany and co-written with Nicholas, Ladylike is a modern day noir that follows Vaughan and Harlan, two vintage vixens who have a penchant for retroâ€¦ and retribution. Not only are they bosom buddies, Vaughan and Harlanâ€™s disturbing pastime makes them a gruesome twosome.

programme.title: NURSE.FIGHTER.BOY.
programme.desc: While working as a night-shift nurse to support her son, Jude, a widowed single mother undergoing treatment for sickle cell disease meets and enters into a relationship with Silence, a troubled and brooding boxer who becomes a father figure for the young boy.

programme.title: MATERNALLY YOURS Episode 1
programme.desc: In this dramedy mini-series, 20-something Sheena is ready to move on from her small city of Alexandria, LA and head to New Orleans.

programme.title: MATERNALLY YOURS Episode 2
programme.desc: In this dramedy mini-series, 20-something Sheena is ready to move on from her small city of Alexandria, LA and head to New Orleans.

programme.desc: In this dramedy mini-series, 20-something Sheena is ready to move on from her small city of Alexandria, LA and head to New Orleans.

programme.title: LITTLE MUSIC MANCHILD: THE STORY OF MALIK KOFI
programme.desc: The story follows an 11-year old African American Birmingham native, child prodigy who plays the cello.

programme.title: A DIOS MOMO
programme.desc: Little Obdulio sells newspapers on the street to bring home a few coins for his family. His life is altered when he befriends the night watchman of the newspaper, a magical "Maestro," who will not only introduce him to reading, but also teach him the real meaning of life, using the lyrics of the "Murgas" under the spell of the God MoMo during the mythical nights of the Uruguayan Carnival.
